metadata.dc:author: Pertusa Peña, Carlos
Lecumberri Castaños, David
Martín Bazaco, Jesús
Azurmendi Sastre, Víctor
Crespo Atín, Víctor
Eizaguirre Zarzai, Beatriz
Llarena Ibarguren, Roberto
Padilla Nieva, Jesús
metadata.dc:description: OBJECTIVES We report the first case of bilateral renal solitary fibrous tumor diagnosed in a patient suffering from tuberous sclerosis. METHODS From the bibliographic review, only 15 cases of solitary fibrous tumor have been described in the kidney. We did not find any case of simultaneous bilateral involvement. We did not find any case described in a patient with tuberous sclerosis either, as the present case, being a 51-year-old female with presenting with a big abdominal mass arising from the left kidney (25 cm) and another 2 cm mass in the right kidney. CONCLUSIONS We emphasize the extreme rarity of this tumor in the kidney. It has benign characteristics and behavior, and good prognosis, but requires surgical treatment to obtain a proper histopathologic diagnosis, based on immuno-histochemical studies.
metadata.dc:title: Tumor fibroso solitario renal bilateral.
[Bilateral renal solitary fibrous tumor].
